definitions.definition: to suggest a plan, an idea, etc. for people to think about and decide on
definitions.sensetop: propose somethingpropose that…it is proposed that…propose doing somethingit is proposed to do something

examples.text: The government **proposed changes** to the voting system.
The Board of Directors is **proposing an amendment** to Article I.
The three countries had **proposed a plan** for him to hand over power to a chosen successor.
What would you propose?
Other services will not be affected by the proposed legislation.
It is one of several proposed hospital developments around town.
Since the idea was first proposed, no action has been taken.
a proposed reform/rule/law/project
This year we propose a tax increase of 3.9 percent.
She proposed that the book be banned.
She proposed that the book should be banned.
It was proposed that the president be elected for a period of two years.
He proposed changing the name of the company.
It was proposed to pay the money from public funds.
examples.contextForm: it is proposed to do something

examples.text: The measures have been proposed as a way of improving standards.
The plan originally proposed was ruled completely unrealistic.
the newly proposed amendments
She proposed a reduction in the state president's powers.
The proposed trip to Spain had to be cancelled at the last minute.
Are you seriously proposing that we should allow this situation to continue?

definitions.sensetop: propose to do somethingpropose doing something

examples.text: What do you propose to do now?
How do you propose getting home?
We do not propose to take any further action in the matter.

definitions.definition: to ask somebody to marry you

examples.text: He was afraid that if he proposed she might refuse.
She proposed to me!
to propose marriage

definitions.definition: to suggest something at a formal meeting and ask people to vote on it

examples.text: I propose Tom Ellis for chairman.
He was proposed for the job of treasurer.
to **propose a motion** (= to be the main speaker in support of an idea at a formal debate)

definitions.definition: to suggest an explanation of something for people to consider

examples.text: She proposed a possible solution to the mystery.

definitions.definition: to ask people to wish somebody health, happiness and success by raising their glasses and drinking

examples.text: I'd like to propose a toast to the bride and groom.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French proposer, from Latin proponere ‘set forth’ (from pro- ‘forward’ + ponere ‘put’), but influenced by Latin propositus ‘put or set forth’ and Old French poser ‘to place’.
